body: @seeday could you please rebase to the master branch? There are some CI tests issues fixed on the master branch.
@KannarFr Could you please rebase to the master branch?
@avimas Could you please help rebase to the master branch? There are some CI test fix on master branch.
@srkukarni that is the place.  I must have missed it
also, you can not obtain a key-shared subscription currently with the current method. (related to #3208 and #6527)

> @avimas Could you please help rebase to the master branch? There are some CI test fix on master branch.

Done!
@tongsucn Could you please take a look at the CI CPP tests? Looks related to the code format.

I guess that would do it. It changes the behavior for topics created while the client is down or before it is started for the first time. It is probably useful to read all the messages on those when the client comes up - but there could be cases where it is undesirable when the client starts for the first time.

If we do go that way then  #6531 must be fixed as we are actually using functions.
@codelipenghui @sijie  : When is 2.5.3. release planned ? Can you please share with us.
@jiazhai , doc is updated. please help double check. Thanks.
@merlimat Would you please help review it again?
@merlimat Would you please help rebase this change?
@jiazhai , these updates are based on updates for master. updates for master is approved and merged. Therefore, please help approve these updates and merge them.
@jiazhai , these doc updates are based on updates for master. updates for master have been approved and merged. please help approve and merge this PR. Thanks.
@merlimat The broker unit test is so hard to get passed. I'm creating a PR to split the whole broker unit test into multiple parts and fixed some flaky tests. Please take a look at #7173.

Will the topic deletion work on geo-replicated topics too? Because at this moment, for the namespaces that are geo-replicated, the topics doesn't get deleted even if we try disabling the replication by set-clusters.

@Saswatibhoi that is a different issue. For geo-replicated topics, typically the suggestion is to stop using them and unsubscribe, leaving the topic to get auto-deleted.

Surely, there could be an improvement to perform deletion on geo-replicated topics.
@codelipenghui ok thanks, the pipeline finally passed
@addisonj Please merge the master branch to your branch, #7173 has fix some tests issues. I can't push to your branch.
@avimas Please rebase again, I can't push to your master branch. It's better to checkout -b a new branch to create a pull request. #7173 has fix some issues with CI tests.
@jiazhai , whether end-to-end messagecrypto is supported on Python?
Since we're working on the Functions docs, ping @wolfstudy FYI
Thanks @baynes for reporting this issue. Since it is able to reproduce, mark it as help-wanted firstly. Any help on fix this issue is very appreciated.
Thanks for @liudezhi2098 to help on this issue.

> @wolfstudy can you double-check if this is a problem?

Sure, will do this
@skothari-tibco Thanks your feedback, will fix it.

> @tongsucn Could you please take a look at the CI CPP tests? Looks related to the code format.

@codelipenghui Hi, it passes `make check-format` in my container, and running `make format` does not affect any code. This is really weird....

```bash
root@THOSTNAME:/pulsar/pulsar-client-cpp# git rev-parse HEAD
77c84c7efef4732534a38d126a26ba624f7e17f9
root@THOSTNAME:/pulsar/pulsar-client-cpp# git status
On branch ackgroup
Your branch is up-to-date with 'origin/ackgroup'.
nothing to commit, working directory clean
root@THOSTNAME:/pulsar/pulsar-client-cpp# make check-format
Scanning dependencies of target check-format
Built target check-format
```
OK, i will validate it and fix the docs.
last fix was on mac, I will make format under ubuntu env.

Same error with pulsar-admin APIs, It was caused by no validation about non-partitioned topic or partitoined topic before update the partition numbers. 
We should add the validation before do the update.

I set up bookkeeperExplicitLacIntervalInMills in broker.conf and standalone.conf, but still couldn't get the latest news。

@codelipenghui @jiazhai @Anonymitaet , these updates are identical to that for the master, which have been approved and merged.
@Anonymitaet , there is no such doc for versioned docs for releases 2.4.0--2.3.0, copy it from other releases and then update contents. Please just focus on main content updates.
@ltamber Looks the failed tests relate to this PR. I will move it to 2.7.0 first. If you have time, please take a look, thanks.
I used both latest version of dashboard and 2.4.2 based on some comments in issues section
@codelipenghui  rebase done, I'll make sure to use a new branch next time.

We do run the decommission bookie every time to decommission.

Looks like, the topic is stuck on that ledger and is not able to recover no matter of the options we have tried like resetting cursor or skipping messages..
@sijie I have added some documentation.  Can you please check to see if it is appropriate?  If it is can we push this PR through as discussed?
@rdhabalia Looks the failed CI tests related to this PR, could you please take a look? Or can we move it to 2.7.0 first?
@jerrypeng Looks the failed tests related to this PR, could you please take a look, or move it to 2.7.0 first.
@merlimat Looks the failed tests are related to this PR, can we move it to 2.7.0 or release at 2.6.1?
@KannarFr Could you please rebase to the master branch?
move to 2.7.0 first since no any update.
